com.maxwellwheeler.plugins.tppets.storage

Class DBWrapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.maxwellwheeler.plugins.tppets.storage.DBWrapper

  • public class DBWrapper
extends java.lang.Object
    A wrapper class that abstracts away the specific database being used.
    Author:
    GatheringExp

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private DBFrame database 
      private TPPets thisPlugin 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DBWrapper(java.lang.String host, int port, java.lang.String dbName, java.lang.String dbUsername, java.lang.String dbPassword, TPPets thisPlugin)
      Creates a MySQLFrame object that executes subsequent sql operations.
      DBWrapper(java.lang.String dbPath, java.lang.String dbName, TPPets thisPlugin)
      Creates an SQLiteFrame object that executes subsequent sql operations.

      • database

        private DBFrame database

    • Constructor Detail

      • DBWrapper

        public DBWrapper(java.lang.String host,
                 int port,
                 java.lang.String dbName,
                 java.lang.String dbUsername,
                 java.lang.String dbPassword,
                 TPPets thisPlugin)
        Creates a MySQLFrame object that executes subsequent sql operations.
        Parameters:
        host - The host
        port - The port number, between 0 and 65535
        dbName - The name of the database
        dbUsername - The username to use the database
        dbPassword - The password of the user
        thisPlugin - A reference to the TPPets plugin instance

      • DBWrapper

        public DBWrapper(java.lang.String dbPath,
                 java.lang.String dbName,
                 TPPets thisPlugin)
        Creates an SQLiteFrame object that executes subsequent sql operations.
        Parameters:
        dbPath - The path to the object, most often the plugin's directory
        dbName - The name of the database
        thisPlugin - A reference to the TPPets plugin instance.

                                           PetType.Pets pt)
        Generates a unique name for a player's pet. Used for default name creation.
        Parameters:
        ownerUUID - The Owner of the pet to generate a name for
        pt - The type of pet to generate a name for
        Returns:
        A name of the format pt.toString() + an integer

      • updateOrInsertPet

        public boolean updateOrInsertPet(org.bukkit.entity.Entity ent)
        Updates OR inserts the pet, based on whether or not it's already in the table tpp_unloaded_pets. This is recommended to be used whenever possible.
        Parameters:
        ent - The entity to be updated.
        Returns:
        True if successful, false if not

      • petInTable

        private boolean petInTable(org.bukkit.entity.Entity ent)
        Checks if the pet is already in the table tpp_unloaded_pets
        Parameters:
        ent - The entity to be checked
        Returns:
        True if the entity is in the table, false if not

      • renamePet

        public boolean renamePet(java.lang.String ownerUUID,
                         java.lang.String oldName,
                         java.lang.String newName)
        Renames the pet by updating the pet's entry in the database.
        Parameters:
        ownerUUID - The owner of the pet's UUID
        oldName - The pet's old name, used for finding the existing pet to update
        newName - The pet's new name
        Returns:
        True if successful, false if not

      • getAllowedPlayers

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAllowedPlayers(java.lang.String entityUUID)
        Gets a list of trimmed uuids of players that are allowed to a given pet
        Parameters:
        entityUUID - The pet's UUID
        Returns:
        A list of trimmed UUID strings of players allowed to the pet

      • getPetsFromOwnerNamePetType

        public java.util.List<PetStorage> getPetsFromOwnerNamePetType(java.lang.String ownerUUID,
                                                              java.lang.String petName,
                                                              PetType.Pets pt)
        Gets a list of PetStorages representing pets in unloaded chunks. Gets all pets with petName, ownerUUID, and type pt
        Parameters:
        ownerUUID - The pet owner's UUID
        petName - The pet's name
        pt - The pet's type
        Returns:
        A list of PetStorages representing pets in unloaded chunks

      • getPetByName

        public PetStorage getPetByName(java.lang.String ownerUUID,
                               java.lang.String petName)
        Gets a trimmed version of the pet's UUID based on its owner's UUID and pet name
        Parameters:
        ownerUUID - The owner of the pet's UUID represented as a string. Does not need to be trimmed.
        petName - The pet's name
        Returns:
        A trimmed string version of the pet's UUID. Returns null if the database connection can't be made, returns empty string if can't find pet with that name from that owner

        playerUUID - The player's UUID
        Returns:

      • getPetsFromOwner

        public java.util.List<PetStorage> getPetsFromOwner(java.lang.String uuid)
        Gets a list of pets from storage based on the owner's UUID.
        Parameters:
        uuid - The trimmed or non-trimmed UUID string of the owner.
        Returns:
        A list of pets from storage that are owned by the provided UUID.

      • getPetsFromUUIDs

        public java.util.List<PetStorage> getPetsFromUUIDs(java.lang.String petUuid,
                                                   java.lang.String playerUuid)
        Gets a list of pets from storage based on the pet's UUID and owner's UUID
        Parameters:
        petUuid - The trimmed or non-trimmed UUID string of the pet.
        playerUuid - The trimmed or non-trimmed UUID string of the owner.
        Returns:
        A list of pets from storage that have the uuid PetUuid and are owned by playerUuid

      • getPetsGeneric

        public java.util.List<PetStorage> getPetsGeneric(java.lang.String playerUuid,
                                                 java.lang.String worldName,
                                                 PetType.Pets petType)
        Gets a list of pets from storage based on the owner's UUId, world, and type of pets. Useful for teleporting pets from unloaded chunks.
        Parameters:
        playerUuid - The trimmed or non-trimmed UUID string of the owner.
        worldName - The name of the world to be searched.
        petType - The type of pet to be searched for.
        Returns:
        A list of pets from storage that are owned by the playerUuid, are in the worldName, and are of type petType.

      • getPetsFromWorld

        public java.util.List<PetStorage> getPetsFromWorld(java.lang.String worldName)
        Gets a list of pets from storage based on the world.
        Parameters:
        worldName - The name of the world to be searched.
        Returns:
        A list of pets from storage that are in the worldName.

      • getPetsList

        private java.util.List<PetStorage> getPetsList(java.sql.ResultSet rs)
        Gets a list of pets from storage based on a given ResultSet. This is used in the processing of most other getPets-type methods.
        Parameters:
        rs - The ResultSet to analyze, presumably from the tpp_unloaded_pets table.
        Returns:
        A list of pets created from rs.

        public boolean insertLostRegion(LostAndFoundRegion lfr)
        Inserts a LostAndFoundRegion into the database.
        Parameters:
        lfr - The LostAndFoundRegion instance to add to the database.
        Returns:
        True if successful, false if not

        public boolean deleteLostRegion(LostAndFoundRegion lfr)
        Removes a LostAndFoundRegion from the database.
        Parameters:
        lfr - The LostAndFoundRegion instance to remove from the database.
        Returns:
        True if successful, false if not.

      • getLostRegions

        public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,LostAndFoundRegion> getLostRegions()
        Gets the Hashtable used by the plugin internally to store the LostAndFoundRegion in memory from the database.
        Returns:
        The Hashtable of <LostAndFoundRegion's name, LostAndFoundRegion instance>

      • getAllAllowedPlayers

        public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> getAllAllowedPlayers()
        Gets a Hashtable of <Trimmed Pet UUID, List<Trimmed Player UUID>> representing the players that are allowed to all pets. Used in TPPets initialization process
        Returns:
        Hashtable of <Trimmed Pet UUID, List<Trimmed Player UUID>>. It will never be null, but it could be empty

      • updateProtectedRegion

        public boolean updateProtectedRegion(ProtectedRegion pr)
        Updates the given ProtectedRegion's lfName in the database.
        Parameters:
        pr - The ProtectedRegion whose lfName is to be updated.
        Returns:
        True if successful, false if not.

        storageName - The name of the storage.
        loc - The location of the storage.
        Returns:
        True if successful, false if not.

                                     java.lang.String storageName)
        Removes a storage location from the payer storage database.
        Parameters:
        playerUUID - The UUID of the player to remove the storage from.
        storageName - The name of the storage.
        Returns:
        True if successful, false if not.

      • getStorageLocation

        public StorageLocation getStorageLocation(java.lang.String playerUUID,
                                          java.lang.String storageName)
        Gets storage locations from a particular player and name.
        Parameters:
        playerUUID - The player to retrieve storage locations from.
        storageName - The name of the storage location.
        Returns:
        The StorageLocation specified, null otherwise.

      • getStorageLocations

        public java.util.List<StorageLocation> getStorageLocations(java.lang.String playerUUID)
        Gets all storage locations of a particular player
        Parameters:
        playerUUID - The player to get the storage locations from.
        Returns:
        A list of storage locations that the player owns. If there was an error connecting with the database, this is null.

        Returns:
        True if successful, false if not.

      • removeServerStorageLocation

                                           org.bukkit.World world)
        Removes a server-wide storage location.
        Parameters:
        storageName - The name of the location to remove.
        world - The world from which to remove the location.
        Returns:
        True if successful, false if not.

      • getServerStorageLocation

        public StorageLocation getServerStorageLocation(java.lang.String storageName,
                                                org.bukkit.World world)
        Gets a specific server storage location from its name and world.
        Parameters:
        storageName - Name of the storage location
        world - The world the storage location is in
        Returns:
        Object representing the storage location

      • getDefaultServerStorageLocation

        public StorageLocation getDefaultServerStorageLocation(org.bukkit.World world)
        Gets the default server storage location from the world. It selects the first database entry found if allowTpBetweenWorlds has been set. If not, it takes the storage location specific to the world.
        Parameters:
        world - The world to get the default storage location from
        Returns:
        The default storage location if found, null if can't be found.

      • getServerStorageLocations

        public java.util.List<StorageLocation> getServerStorageLocations(org.bukkit.World world)
        Gets all server storage locations in a world, used for listing existing server storage locations.
        Parameters:
        world - The world to find storage locations in.
        Returns:
        A list of storage locations.

      • getNumPetsByPT

        public int getNumPetsByPT(java.lang.String ownerUUID,
                          PetType.Pets pt)
        Gets the number of pets a player owns by the owner's UUID and pet type
        Parameters:
        ownerUUID - The owner's UUID
        pt - The pet's type
        Returns:
        Number of pets a player owns of that type

      • getNumPets

        public int getNumPets(java.lang.String ownerUUID)
        Gets the number of pets a player owns by the owner's UUID
        Parameters:
        ownerUUID - The owner's UUID
        Returns:
        Number of pets a player owns

      • getRealDatabase

        public DBFrame getRealDatabase()
        Returns:
        The underlying database object, either of type MySQLFrame or SQLiteFrame
